detaileddescription.para: Unknown
Up
Down
Switch encountered a fatal error
Drop Packet in data plane
Forward Packet in data plane.
Copy Packet to CPU without interfering the original packet action in the pipeline.
Cancel copy the packet to CPU.
Combination of Packet Actions This is a combination of SAI packet action COPY and DROP: A copy of the original packet is sent to CPU port, the original packet is forcefully dropped from the pipeline.

This is a combination of SAI packet action COPY and FORWARD: A copy of the original packet is sent to CPU port, the original packet, if it was to be dropped in the original pipeline, change the pipeline action to forward (cancel drop).
This is a combination of SAI packet action COPY_CANCEL and DROP
This is a combination of SAI packet action COPY_CANCEL and FORWARD
Packet without vlan tags.
Packet outer TPID matches to the ingress port outer TPID and packet inner TPID if present, does not match the configured inner TPID.
Packet outer TPID matches to the ingress port outer TPID and packet inner TPID matches to the configured inner TPID.

briefdescription.para: Attribute data for number of vlan tags present in a packet.

detaileddescription.para: Cut-through switching mode
Store-and-forward switching mode
CRC based hash algorithm
XOR-based hash algorithm
Random-based hash algorithm
Lower 16-bits of CRC32 based hash algorithm
Higher 16-bits of CRC32-based hash algorithm
CRC using CCITT polynomial based hash algorithm
Combination of CRC and XOR based hash algorithm
NPU doesn't support warmboot
Planned restart only
Both planned and unplanned restart
NPU doesn't support IP based L2MC
*G lookup only
SG lookup only
Both *G/SG lookup supported
Hardware access bus is MDIO
Hardware access bus is I2C
Hardware access bus is CPLD
Do not download FW. Use already downloaded FW instead
Download FW internally via MDIO
Load FW from EEPROM
Skip firmware download if firmware is already present
Always download the firmware specified by firmware load method
Check the firmware version. If it is different from current version download firmware
Switch type is Switching Network processing unit
Switch type is PHY
Switch type is VOQ based NPU
Switch type is Fabric switch device
Ports are configured but do not operate in hitless mode
Ports are configured and operate in hitless mode

briefdescription.para: Attribute data for SAI_SWITCH_ATTR_FAILOVER_CONFIG_MODE Used for Failover configuration mode In case of primary port failure, hitless enables the switch over to secondary port without losing link. It allows uninterrupted data transmission.
Number of active(created) ports on the switch.
Maximum number of supported ports on the switch.
Get the Max MTU in bytes, supported by the switch.
Max number of virtual routers supported.
The size of the FDB Table in bytes.
Number of ports that can be part of a LAG.
Number of LAGs that can be created.
ECMP number of members per group.

detaileddescription.para: Default is 64

briefdescription.para: The number of Unicast queues per port.
The number of Multicast queues per port.
The total number of queues per port.

detaileddescription.para: Routes with next hop set to "on-link".

briefdescription.para: Maximum number of temperature sensors available.
List of temperature readings from all sensors.

detaileddescription.para: Values in Celsius.

briefdescription.para: The current value of the maximum temperature retrieved from the switch sensors.

detaileddescription.para: Value in Celsius.

briefdescription.para: The average of temperature readings over all sensors in the switch.

detaileddescription.para: Value in Celsius.

briefdescription.para: Minimum priority for ACL table group.
Maximum priority for ACL table group.
FDB DST user-based meta data range.
Route DST Table user-based meta data range.
Neighbor DST Table user-based meta data range.
ACL user-based ACL meta data range.
Max number of STP instances that NPU supports.

detaileddescription.para: Must return SAI_STATUS_OBJECT_IN_USE when try to delete this VR ID.

briefdescription.para: Switch/Global bind point for ingress ACL object.

detaileddescription.para: Bind (or unbind) an ingress ACL table or ACL group globally. Enable/Update ingress ACL table or ACL group filtering by assigning the list of valid object id. Disable ingress filtering by assigning SAI_NULL_OBJECT_ID in the attribute value.

briefdescription.para: Switch/Global bind point for egress ACL object.

detaileddescription.para: Bind (or unbind) an egress ACL tables or ACL group globally. Enable/Update egress ACL table or ACL group filtering by assigning the list of valid object id. Disable egress filtering by assigning SAI_NULL_OBJECT_ID in the attribute value.

briefdescription.para: HQOS - Maximum Number of Hierarchy scheduler group levels(depth) supported.
HQOS - Maximum number of scheduler groups supported on each Hierarchy level.
HQOS - Maximum number of childs supported per scheduler group.
Switch total buffer size in KB.
Switch number of ingress buffer pool.
Switch number of egress buffer pool.
Available Next hop group member entries.

detaileddescription.para: Default value after switch initialization:

SAI_HOSTIF_TRAP_GROUP_ATTR_ADMIN_STATE = true SAI_HOSTIF_TRAP_GROUP_ATTR_PRIO = SAI_SWITCH_ATTR_ACL_TABLE_MINIMUM_PRIORITY SAI_HOSTIF_TRAP_GROUP_ATTR_QUEUE = 0 SAI_HOSTIF_TRAP_GROUP_ATTR_POLICER = SAI_NULL_OBJECT_ID
The group handle is read only, while the group attributes, such as queue and policer, may be modified.

briefdescription.para: The hash object for packets going through ECMP.

detaileddescription.para: Default value after switch initialization:

SAI_HASH_ATTR_NATIVE_HASH_FIELD_LIST = [SAI_NATIVE_HASH_FIELD_SRC_MAC, SAI_NATIVE_HASH_FIELD_DST_MAC, SAI_NATIVE_HASH_FIELD_IN_PORT, SAI_NATIVE_HASH_FIELD_ETHERTYPE] SAI_HASH_ATTR_UDF_GROUP_LIST empty list
The object id is read only, while the object attributes can be modified.

briefdescription.para: The hash object for packets going through LAG.

detaileddescription.para: Default value after switch initialization:

SAI_HASH_ATTR_NATIVE_HASH_FIELD_LIST = [SAI_NATIVE_HASH_FIELD_SRC_MAC, SAI_NATIVE_HASH_FIELD_DST_MAC, SAI_NATIVE_HASH_FIELD_IN_PORT, SAI_NATIVE_HASH_FIELD_ETHERTYPE] SAI_HASH_ATTR_UDF_GROUP_LIST empty list)
The object id is read only, while the object attributes can be modified.

Indicates controlled warm restart. Since warm restart can be caused by crash (therefore there are no guarantees for this call), this hint is really a performance optimization. This hint is set as part of the shutdown sequence, before boot. TRUE - Warm Reboot FALSE - Cold Reboot

Start warm boot recovery when set to true This hint is set after boot. In case of host adapter restart, host adapter can pass boot type in SAI_KEY_BOOT_TYPE. In case of host adapter recovery, host adapter can pass a hint about the boot type and recovery, in this flag.

briefdescription.para: Minimum interval of time required by SAI for planned restart in milliseconds.

detaileddescription.para: Will be 0 for SAI_SWITCH_RESTART_TYPE_NONE. The Host Adapter will have to wait for this minimum interval of time before it decides to bring down SAI due to initialize failure.

briefdescription.para: Nonvolatile storage required by both SAI and NPU in KB.

detaileddescription.para: Will be 0 for SAI_SWITCH_RESTART_TYPE_NONE.

briefdescription.para: Count of the total number of actions supported by NPU.
Count of the total number of ranges supported by NPU.
ACL capabilities supported by the NPU.
Multicast snooping capability supported by the NPU.
L2 broadcast flood control to CPU port.
L2 multicast flood control to CPU port.
Maximum number of learned MAC addresses.

detaileddescription.para: Zero means learning limit is disabled.

briefdescription.para: Dynamic FDB entry aging time in seconds.

detaileddescription.para: Zero means aging is disabled.

briefdescription.para: Flood control for packets with unknown destination address.

detaileddescription.para: When set, the hash calculation will result in the same value as when the source and destination addresses (L2 src/dst MAC,L3 src/dst IP,L4 src/dst port) were swapped, ensuring the same conversation will result in the same hash value.

briefdescription.para: The hash object for IPv4 packets going through ECMP.
The hash object for IPv4 in IPv4 packets going through ECMP.
The hash object for IPv6 packets going through ECMP.

detaileddescription.para: When set, the hash calculation will result in the same value as when the source and destination addresses (L2 src/dst MAC,L3 src/dst IP,L4 src/dst port) were swapped, ensuring the same conversation will result in the same hash value.

briefdescription.para: The hash object for IPv4 packets going through LAG.
The hash object for IPv4 in IPv4 packets going through LAG.
The hash object for IPv6 packets going through LAG.

detaileddescription.para:
The SDK can
1 - Read the counters directly from HW (or) 2 - Cache the counters in SW. Caching is typically done if retrieval of counters directly from HW for each counter read is CPU intensive
This setting can be used to
1 - Move from HW based to SW based or Vice versa 2 - Configure the SW counter cache refresh rate
Setting a value of 0 enables direct HW based counter read. A non zero value enables the SW cache based and the counter refresh rate.
A NPU may support both or one of the option. It would return error for unsupported options
Default - 1 sec (SW counter cache)

briefdescription.para: Enable DOT1P -> TC MAP on switch.

detaileddescription.para: MAP id = SAI_NULL_OBJECT_ID to disable map on switch. To enable/disable trust Dot1p, Map ID should be added/removed on switch. Default disabled.

briefdescription.para: Enable DOT1P -> COLOR MAP on switch.

detaileddescription.para: MAP id = SAI_NULL_OBJECT_ID to disable map on switch. To enable/disable trust Dot1p, Map ID should be added/removed on switch. Default disabled.

briefdescription.para: Enable DSCP -> TC MAP on switch.

detaileddescription.para: MAP id = SAI_NULL_OBJECT_ID to disable map on switch. To enable/disable trust DSCP, Map ID should be added/removed on port. Default no map.

briefdescription.para: Enable DSCP -> COLOR MAP on switch.

detaileddescription.para: MAP id = SAI_NULL_OBJECT_ID to disable map on switch. To enable/disable trust DSCP, Map ID should be added/removed on switch. Default no map.

briefdescription.para: Enable TC -> Queue MAP on switch.

detaileddescription.para: Map id = SAI_NULL_OBJECT_ID to disable map on switch. Default no map i.e All packets to queue 0.
Map id = SAI_NULL_OBJECT_ID to disable map on switch. Default no map
Map id = SAI_NULL_OBJECT_ID to disable map on switch. Default no map.
Use this to retrieve the Key-Value pairs as part of switch initialization.

Hardware information format is based on SAI implementations by vendors. String is NULL terminated. Format is vendor specific. Example: Like PCI location, I2C address etc. In case of NULL, First NPU attached to CPU will be initialized. Single NPU case this attribute is optional.

briefdescription.para: Vendor specific path name of the firmware to load.
Set to switch initialization or connect to NPU/SDK.

detaileddescription.para: TRUE - Initialize switch/SDK. FALSE - Connect to SDK. This will connect library to the initialized SDK. After this call the capability attributes should be ready for retrieval via sai_get_switch_attribute()

briefdescription.para: Operational status change notification callback function passed to the adapter.

detaileddescription.para: Use sai_switch_state_change_notification_fn as notification function.

briefdescription.para: Shutdown notification callback function passed to the adapter.

detaileddescription.para: Use sai_switch_shutdown_request_notification_fn as notification function.

briefdescription.para: FDB event notification callback function passed to the adapter.

detaileddescription.para: Use sai_fdb_event_notification_fn as notification function.

briefdescription.para: Port state change notification callback function passed to the adapter.

detaileddescription.para: In case driver does not support this attribute, The Host adapter should poll port status by SAI_PORT_ATTR_OPER_STATUS.
Use sai_port_state_change_notification_fn as notification function.

briefdescription.para: Received packet event notification callback function passed to the adapter.

detaileddescription.para: Use sai_packet_event_notification_fn as notification function.

briefdescription.para: Enable SAI function call fast mode, which executes calls very quickly.

detaileddescription.para: This setting will apply to all mirror sessions.
Default of 255 = disabled. When this attribute is disabled, the TC of the mirrored frame will be derived from the packet (the DOT1P priority in the VLAN Tag, for example).

briefdescription.para: Max number of Segments in a single SID List supported.
List of Type Length Value types supported for source.
The number of lossless queues per port supported by the switch.
Set Switch PFC deadlock event notification callback function passed to the adapter.

detaileddescription.para: Use sai_queue_pfc_deadlock_notification_fn as notification function.

briefdescription.para: Control for buffered and incoming packets on queue undergoing PFC Deadlock Recovery.

detaileddescription.para: This control applies to all packets on all applicable port/queues. If application wants finer packet action control on per port per queue level then it is expected to set this control to packet forward and install one or more ACL and enable/disable them in the DLD/DLR event callback (SAI_SWITCH_ATTR_PFC_DEADLOCK_EVENT_NOTIFY) respectively.

briefdescription.para: PFC Deadlock Detection timer interval range.
PFC Deadlock Detection timer interval in milliseconds.

detaileddescription.para: If the monitored queue is in XOFF state for more than this duration then its considered to be in a PFC deadlock state and recovery process is kicked off. Note: Use TC (Traffic Class) value as key and timer interval as value.

briefdescription.para: PFC Deadlock Recovery timer interval range.
PFC Deadlock Recovery timer interval in milliseconds.

detaileddescription.para: The PFC deadlock recovery process will run for this amount of time and then normal state will resume. If the system remains in a deadlock state then the detection and recovery will resume again after the configured detection timer interval. Note: Use TC (Traffic Class) value as key and timer interval as value.

briefdescription.para: Get the list of supported protected object types. See comment for SAI_NEXT_HOP_GROUP_MEMBER_ATTR_MONITORED_OBJECT for more details.
Perform CRC recalculation (overwriting CRC value on egress)
Set Switch BFD session state change event notification callback function passed to the adapter.

detaileddescription.para: Use sai_bfd_session_state_change_notification_fn as notification function.

briefdescription.para: Number of BFD session in the NPU.
Max number of BFD session NPU supports.
List of BFD session offloads that are supported for IPv4.
List of BFD session offloads that are supported for IPv6.
Minimum Receive interval NPU supports in microseconds.
Minimum Transmit interval NPU supports in microseconds.
Apply ECN thresholds for ECT traffic. Attribute controls whether ECT traffic needs to subjected to WRED thresholds or be subjected to ECN thresholds.
Default VXLAN router MAC (inner destination MAC for VXLAN encapsulation)
Max number of mirror session NPU supports.
Max number of sampled mirror session NPU supports.
Get the list of supported get statistics extended modes Empty list should be returned if get statistics extended is not supported at all.
Uninitialize data plane upon removal of switch object.

detaileddescription.para: Typical use case for tear down of the host adapter, is to remove the switch ID, which will stop all data and control plane, as leaving data plane open without control can be a security risk. However, on some scenarios, such as fast boot, host adapter would like to set this value to false, call remove switch, and have the data plane still running.
Bind (or unbind) the TAM object. SAI_NULL_OBJECT_ID in the attribute value.

briefdescription.para: Event notification callback function passed to the adapter.

detaileddescription.para: Use sai_tam_event_notification_fn as notification function.
A list of object types (sai_object_type_t) that the SAI adapter can support.

briefdescription.para: Instruct SAI to execute switch pre-shutdown.

detaileddescription.para: Indicates controlled switch pre-shutdown as first step of warm shutdown. This hint is optional, SAI application could skip this step and go directly to warm shutdown. This hint should be ignored, if at the time SAI receives this hint, SAI_SWITCH_ATTR_RESTART_WARM is NOT already set to TRUE. The scope of pre-shutdown is to backup SAI/SDK data, but leave CPU port active for some final control plane traffic to go out. TRUE - Execute switch pre-shutdown for warm shutdown FALSE - No-op, does NOT mean cancelling already executed pre-shutdown
Bind (or unbind) the NAT zone counter object. SAI_NULL_OBJECT_ID in the attribute value.

Platform context information provided by the host adapter to driver. This information is Host adapter specific, typically used for maintain synchronization and device information. Driver will give this context back to adapter as part of call back sai_switch_register_read/write_fn API.

briefdescription.para: Platform adaption device read callback function passed to the adapter. This is mandatory function for driver when device access not supported by file system.

detaileddescription.para: Use sai_switch_register_read_fn as read function.

briefdescription.para: Platform adaption device write callback function passed to the adapter. This is mandatory function for driver when device access not supported by file system.

detaileddescription.para: Use sai_switch_register_write_fn as write function.
TRUE - Enable firmware download as broadcast. FALSE - Enable firmware download as unicast.
Check firmware version. If it is different from current version load firmware. Otherwise always download the firmware specified by firmware load method.
In case of firmware download method broadcast, Set this attribute on any one of device connected to same bus. As part of execute firmware will broadcast to to all broadcast enabled devices on bus.
Broadcast is enabled for BUS, All configurations will be broadcast. End broadcast before initialize device.

briefdescription.para: Firmware status verify and complete initialize device.

detaileddescription.para: Host Adapter should mandatory to set attribute to true, switch before doing any other configurations.
Indicates firmware download and running status.
TRUE - Firmware running FALSE - Firmware not running.
validonly SAI_SWITCH_ATTR_TYPE == SAI_SWITCH_TYPE_PHY

briefdescription.para: Propagate line side port state to system side port.

detaileddescription.para: System side port state will reflect the ASIC port state. Host adapter can depends on ASIC port state instead of port states from system side, line side and ASIC port to determine interface operation status to application.
TRUE - Device support for propagate line side port link status to system side port. FALSE - Device does not support propagate port states.
validonly SAI_SWITCH_ATTR_TYPE == SAI_SWITCH_TYPE_PHY

briefdescription.para: Enable EXP -> TC MAP on switch.

detaileddescription.para: MAP id = SAI_NULL_OBJECT_ID to disable map on switch. Default no map.

briefdescription.para: Enable EXP -> COLOR MAP on switch.

detaileddescription.para: MAP id = SAI_NULL_OBJECT_ID to disable map on switch. Default no map in which case all exp values map to green color
Map id = SAI_NULL_OBJECT_ID to disable map on switch. Default no map.

briefdescription.para: Vendor specific switch ID. Identifies switch chip.

detaileddescription.para: Mandatory in VOQ Switch

briefdescription.para: Maximum number of cores in the VOQ System (chassis)
Number of fabric ports on the switch.
The size of the packet DMA pool memory in bytes This can be used in conjunction with sai_allocate_hostif_packet_fn to allocate a pool of memory upfront and manage it in the application.
Packet action when a packet ingress and gets routed back to same tunnel.

detaileddescription.para: Custom range base value
End of custom range base

briefdescription.para: Attribute Id in sai_set_switch_attribute() and sai_get_switch_attribute() calls.

detaileddescription.para: Switch stat in drop reasons range start
Get in switch packet drops configured by debug counter API at index 0
Get in switch packet drops configured by debug counter API at index 1
Get in switch packet drops configured by debug counter API at index 2
Get in switch packet drops configured by debug counter API at index 3
Get in switch packet drops configured by debug counter API at index 4
Get in switch packet drops configured by debug counter API at index 5
Get in switch packet drops configured by debug counter API at index 6
Get in switch packet drops configured by debug counter API at index 7
Switch stat in drop reasons range end
Switch stat out drop reasons range start
Get out switch packet drops configured by debug counter API at index 0
Get out switch packet drops configured by debug counter API at index 1
Get out switch packet drops configured by debug counter API at index 2
Get out switch packet drops configured by debug counter API at index 3
Get out switch packet drops configured by debug counter API at index 4
Get out switch packet drops configured by debug counter API at index 5
Get out switch packet drops configured by debug counter API at index 6
Get out switch packet drops configured by debug counter API at index 7
Switch stat out drop reasons range end
Switch stat fabric drop reasons range start
Get ECC discards [fabric]
Get reach-ability discards [switch | fabric]
Congestion related high watermark [switch]
Discards not counted in other switch stat type [switch | fabric]
Switch stat fabric drop reasons range end

briefdescription.para: Switch counter IDs in sai_get_switch_stats() call.
Attribute data for number of vlan tags present in a packet.

Attribute data for SAI_SWITCH_ATTR_FAILOVER_CONFIG_MODE Used for Failover configuration mode In case of primary port failure, hitless enables the switch over to secondary port without losing link. It allows uninterrupted data transmission.
Attribute Id in sai_set_switch_attribute() and sai_get_switch_attribute() calls.
Switch counter IDs in sai_get_switch_stats() call.

detaileddescription.para: Adapter DLL may request a shutdown due to an unrecoverable failure or a maintenance operation

briefdescription.para: Platform specific device register read access.

detaileddescription.para: This API provides platform adaption functionality to access device registers from driver. This is mandatory to pass as attribute to sai_create_switch when driver implementation does not support register access by device file system directly.

parameterdescription.para: Number of consecutive registers to read

parameterdescription.para: Number of consecutive registers to write

detaileddescription.para: SDK initialization/connect to SDK. After the call the capability attributes should be ready for retrieval via sai_get_switch_attribute(). Same Switch Object id should be given for create/connect for each NPU.

simplesect.para: SAI_STATUS_SUCCESS on success, failure status code on error

detaileddescription.para: Release all resources associated with currently opened switch

simplesect.para: SAI_STATUS_SUCCESS on success, failure status code on error

simplesect.para: SAI_STATUS_SUCCESS on success, failure status code on error

briefdescription.para: Switch method table retrieved with sai_api_query()

detaileddescription.para: Maximum length of switch attribute key string that can be set using key=value
Maximum count of switch attribute keys

simplesect.para: This value needs to be incremented whenever a new switch attribute key is added.

detaileddescription.para: 0: cold boot. Initialize NPU and external phys. 1: warm boot. Do not re-initialize NPU or external phys, reconstruct SAI/SDK state from stored state. 2: fast boot. Only initialize NPU. SAI/SDK state should not be persisted except for those related to physical port attributes such as SPEED, AUTONEG mode, admin state, operational status.
The file to recover SAI/NPU state from
The file to write SAI/NPU state to
Vendor specific Configuration file for Hardware Port Profile ID parameters. HW port profile ID can be used to set vendor specific port attributes based on the transceiver type plugged in to the port
